With FULL questionnaire parameters
=================================================================

-------------------
[SAMPLE] QUESTIONNAIRE_ID: 500100043
     - Topic: Roadmap planning feedback
     - Question number: 5

-------------------
[TEST] QUESTIONNAIRE_ID: 1146002
     - Topic: Stress at work
     - Question number: 7
-------------------
[PROMPTS]
     - System: 
You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.
Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic and the number of questions.
Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.
Be creative and vary the syntax of your questions to enhance user engagement. 

     - User: 
Generate me a questionnaire on Stress at work with 7 questions

-------------------
-------------------
[LLM ANSWER]
 **How often do you feel stressed because of your job responsibilities and tasks (daily, weekly or monthly)? Please specify.**
- Daily
- Weekly
- Monthly
- Rarely
- Never
**Do the organizational culture and communication style in our company contribute to stress? If yes then how would you rate it on a scale from 1 -5 where one is not stressed at all, while five indicates high level of work related pressure.** Please elaborate. (Open ended question) **How do your direct supervisors or managers influence the amount and frequency of job-related tension in terms of communication style?**
- Not influential
- Slightly Influential
  - Somewhat influencial
    - Highily Influentional, explain with examples if possible. (Open ended question) **Do you feel that your workload is manageable and does not cause stress or do the tasks assigned to you are too many?** Please specify on a scale from one-ten where ten indicates unbearably high amount of task load
  - Yes it's completely fine, I can handle everything. (1) **Do certain aspects/tasks in your job give more pressure than others and if yes then which ones do you find most stressful?** Please specify on a scale from one-ten where ten indicates unbearably high amount of task load
  - Yes there are some tasks that I consider to be very pressurizing. (1) **Do the resources provided by our company help in reducing your work related pressure and if not then which areas need improvement?** Please specify on a scale from one-ten where ten indicates unbearably low amount of resource availability
  - No, there are several things that could be improved to make my job less stressful. (10) **Do you feel comfortable sharing your concerns about work related pressure with the management and if not then why?** Please specify on a scale from one-ten where ten indicates complete lack in confidence of communication
  - Yes, I am completely open for discussion regarding this matter to my superiors as well. (10)
     - User: 
Generate me a questionnaire on Stress at work with 7 questions

[SAMPLE] QUESTIONNAIRE_ID: 500100035
     - Topic: Onboarding Experience
     - Question number: 6

-------------------
[TEST] QUESTIONNAIRE_ID: 1173001
     - Topic: Remote working experience
     - Question number: 10
-------------------
[PROMPTS]
     - System: 
You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.
Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic and the number of questions.
Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.
Be creative and vary the syntax of your questions to enhance user engagement. 

     - User: 
Generate me a questionnaire on Remote working experience with 10 questions

-------------------
-------------------
[LLM ANSWER]
 **What is your overall opinion about remote work as an employee in this company, and how would you rate it from one to five (with five being best)? Please elaborate.**
   - Strongly agree that the option of remote work should be available for all employees. The number 5 has been selected because I believe everyone deserves a good quality life with flexible working conditions allowing them more time dedicated towards their families and hobbies, without feeling guilty about not spending enough hours at office but still being productive
   - Agree that the option of remote work should be available for all employees. The number 4 has been selected because I believe everyone deserves a good quality life with flexible working conditions allowing them more time dedicated towards their families and hobbies, without feeling guilty about not spending enough hours at office but still being productive
   - Neutral: Neither agree nor disagree that the option of remote work should be available for all employees. The number 3 has been selected because I believe everyone deserves a good quality life with flexible working conditions allowing them more time dedicated towards their families and hobbies, without feeling guilty about not spending enough hours at office but still being productive
   - Disagree that the option of remote work should be available for all employees. The number 2 has been selected because I believe everyone deserves a good quality life with flexible working conditions allowing them more time dedicated towards their families and hobbies, without feeling guilty about not spending enough hours at office but still being productive
   - Strongly disagree that the option of remote work should be available for all employees. The number 1 has been selected because I believe everyone deserves a good quality life with flexible working conditions allowing them more time dedicated towards their families and hobbies, without feeling guilty about not spending enough hours at office but still being productive
   ------------------
   **Do you feel that your productivity is higher or lower when remote work compared to in-office? Please elaborate.**
     - Productivity has increased by X% because of the flexibility provided through this option. I can focus more on my tasks and responsibilities without feeling guilty about not spending enough hours at office but still being productive, which helps me maintain a healthy balance between personal life/hobbies & work commitments (please insert percentage)
     - Productivity has increased by X% because of the flexibility provided through this option. I can focus more on my tasks and responsibilities without feeling guilty about not spending enough hours at office but still being productive, which helps me maintain a healthy balance between personal life/hobbies & work commitments (please insert percentage)
     - Productivity has remained same as in-office because of the flexibility provided through this option. I can focus more on my tasks and responsibilities without feeling guilty about not spending enough hours at office but still being productive, which helps me maintain a healthy balance between personal life/hobbies & work commitments (please insert percentage)
     - Productivity has decreased by X% because of the flexibility provided through this option. I can focus more on my tasks and responsibilities without feeling guilty about not spending enough hours at office but still being productive, which helps me maintain a healthy balance between personal life/hobbies & work commitments (please insert percentage)
     - Productivity has decreased by X% because of the flexibility provided through this option. I can focus more on my tasks and responsibilities without feeling guilty about not spending enough hours at office but still being productive, which helps me maintain a healthy balance between personal life/hobbies & work commitments (please insert percentage)
   ------------------
   **Do you feel that your communication with colleagues is as effective in remote working environment? Please elaborate.**
     - Yes: Communication has been enhanced by X% because of the flexibility provided through this option. I can focus more on my tasks and responsibilities without feeling guilty about not spending enough hours at office but still being productive, which helps me maintain a healthy balance between personal life/hobbies & work commitments (please insert percentage)
     - Yes: Communication has been enhanced by X% because of the flexibility provided through this option. I can focus more on my tasks and responsponsibilities without feeling guilty about not spending enough hours at office but still being productive, which helps me maintain a healthy balance between personal life/hobbies & work commitments (please insert percentage)
     - Yes: Communication has remained same in remote working environment because of the flexibility provided through this option. - Employee receiving the news about end of work contract.   
- Manager delivering or communicating to an employee that their employment will be terminated at a certain date and time due to various reasons like budget cuts etc..  - Other: __________________

 **How long have you been working with this company?**  
- Less than one year    
- More then One Year   
	+ If more, how many years (10 questions)      + How did the news affect your performance and productivity in last few months of employment.  - Neutral or not sure if it is related to end work relationship but can be a factor   + Did you feel that there was enough support from HR department during this time?

- Less than one year     	+ More then One Year   If more: 5 years and less; between five to ten yrs etc (10 questions)     - Did the company provide any resources or support that would help me find a new job within my field of expertise.       + Were you able to say goodbye personally with your colleagues?   
- Yes, I was given opportunity for farewell and thanked everyone in person  	+ No: 10 questions     - How did the company handle communication about end work relationship (positive or negative)?      o Positively. Generate me a questionnaire on Employee feedback with 4 questions

-------------------
-------------------
[LLM ANSWER]
 **How often do you give and receive employee performance reviews?** (Please select one)
- Daily or weekly, as needed. I am always ready to provide constructive criticism when necessary but also know how much it means for people if they can hear something positive about themselves! This helps me stay in touch with my team members' needs too - not just through formal meetings once per year like many companies do;
- Monthly or bi monthly, as needed. I believe that regular feedback is essential to keep employees engaged and motivated so prefer this frequency over others because it allows enough time between sessions while still being frequent enough for everyone involved in the process of giving/receiving criticism feel comfortable with their roles within an organization's culture;
- Quarterly or 4 times per year. I think that quarterly reviews are perfect as they provide a good balance between frequency and depth, allowing me to give detailed feedback without overwhelming people who might be receiving it all at once! This also gives enough time for reflection on both sides before meeting again which can help make those conversations more productive;
- Annually or less than 4 times per year. I am not sure if annual reviews are still effective because they seem too infrequent, and the lack of regular communication might lead to misunderstandings about expectations between managers/employees that could have been avoided with just a little bit higher frequency! However sometimes it's necessary due various reasons such as limited resources or high number of direct reports.
Please specify if you prefer another time period for giving employee performance reviews, and why? (open-ended) ------------------
**Do your employees feel comfortable providing feedback to their managers directly during the review process without any fear/pressure from higher management levels about it being anonymous vs nonanonymous or not at all ? Please select one.**   - Yes; they do because we have a transparent culture and open communication channels, which makes them confident in sharing opinions with me.
- No: but only if there is no possibility for employees to give feedback anonymously during the review process as this can help people feel more comfortable when giving critical comments about their managers or colleagues directly; otherwise they would be too afraid of potential consequences such us discrimination, isolation etc.;  - I'm not sure.
Please specify why you think that your answer is correct? (open-ended)  ------------------    **How do YOU prefer to give and receive employee performance reviews ?** Please select one:     - In person in a face2face meeting with each team member individually, as it allows me better understand their feelings through body language cues.
 	* Via video call or teleconference because this way I can still see people's faces but also have more flexibility when scheduling sessions;   * Through an online tool which has been specifically designed for performance reviews and includes all necessary features such as scoring system, comments section etc., so it saves me time on preparation.
 	* Other (please specify)   ------------------     **Do you think that employee feedback is important?** Please select one:   - Yes; I believe constructive criticism helps people grow personally & professionally and makes them better employees overtime, which benefits the whole organization too! It's crucial for creating a healthy work environment where everyone feels heard.
 	* No because it might cause misunderstandings between managers/employees or even lead to conflicts if not done properly; however I still think that there are other ways of getting information about employees performance and satisfaction such as anonymous surveys, which could be used instead!
     - User:

[LLM ANSWER]
 **Please rate your overall satisfaction of the training program.**

- Very Satisfied (4)
- Moderately Satisfied (3)
- Slightly Unsatisfied (2)
- Not at all satisfied with this course session. Please provide specific reasons for your rating if it is less than 5 points: [1] **How would you rate the effectiveness of learning materials and resources used in delivering training?**

- Very Satisfied With The Quality Of Resources And Tools Provided To Learn From This Course Session. Please Specify If You Have Any Suggestions For Improvement: [4] 
- Moderately satisfied with the learning materials used in delivering training, but there is still room for improvement (3)

- Not at all satisfied with the learning materials used in delivering training, and would like to see significant changes (1) **How well did you feel that your personal needs were met during this course session?**

- Very Good, But There Is Still Room To Make It More Personalized (4)
- Moderately Satisfied With How Your Learning Requirements Were Met In This Training Programme And Would Like Some Changes. Please Specify If You Have Any Suggestions For Improvement: [3]

     - Question number: 7

     - Topic: Employee experience
     - Question number: 16

Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic and the number of questions.
Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.
Be creative and vary the syntax of your questions to enhance user engagement. 

     - User:

Please provide one rating for each of these statements:**<br> <ul><li style="line-height:1.6em;">I feel valued in my role</li><li>The work environment supports me to perform at a high level.</li><li>My personal values align with the company's mission and vision.</li><li>There is open communication within all levels of management, including feedback on performance that I receive from supervisors/managers.<br></li><li>I am able to maintain work-life balance easily</li><li>The resources provided by my employer are sufficient for me to perform well in the role.</li><li>My skills and abilities have been fully utilized within this company, making a positive impact on its success. <br></li><li>There is an emphasis placed upon employee growth through training opportunities.<br></li><li>I feel that I am able to provide input into decisions about my work or projects.</li><li>The tools and technology used in the workplace are up-to date, making it easy for me as a team member. <br></li><li>My supervisors/managers care more than just meeting performance standards; they also consider employee wellbeing.<br></li><li>I am able to work remotely if needed and have accessibility of resources when working from home.</li><li>The company has a good reputation in the industry, which makes me proud as an employer. <br></li><li>There is support for my personal growth within this organization.<br></ul>"

 **What is your role in this organization currently, are you:**
    - An executive / senior manager.
	- A middle management level employee (either department or section head).
  	- Or an individual contributor at the staff member position? Please specify if there's any other designation that fits better for yourself.**
  **Do** *you believe* in your organization, employees have potential to grow and evolve within their roles towards a higher level of responsibility with more authority or not (please select only one answer)?***  	- Yes. I am confident about the growth opportunities available at our company; we hire people who can learn quickly.**
    - Not sure yet as it depends on various factors like resources, budget and management support?** 
     **How long have you been working in your current role within this organization (please select only one answer)?***  	- Less than a year. I am still new to the position but eager for growth.**    - Between One & Two Years; there's room left, and my skills can be further honed?**

     - Question number: 9

[PROMPTS]
     - System: 
You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.

Generate me a questionnaire on Access to Technology and Tools with 9 questions

-------------------
-------------------
[LLM ANSWER]
 **On average, how would you rate your accessibility to technology tools at work out of five (5 being very accessible)? Please select only one answer.**
  1. Extremely inaccessible - I am never able to get the resources that are required for my job role and responsibilities because they simply aren't available or not provided by management, which makes it difficult even with a lot more effort than others put into their work; this is very frustrating!
  2. Somewhat InAccessible – While I can access some tools needed to perform tasks effectively at times but often lack certain resources due either limited availability from the company itself or not having enough for everyone who needs them, which makes things challenging and causes me extra stress because of it; this is still frustrating!
  3. Neutral - Accessibility seems just right: neither too hard nor easy to get what I need with technology tools required in my job role & responsibilities without much hassle or frustration involved (5) – This answer indicates that the person feels comfortable and satisfied about their access level, but they don't feel like a hero because of it.
  4. Somewhat Accessible - Technology resources are generally available when needed with only minor inconveniences such as occasional delays in getting specific tools or software licenses; this is not frustrating at all (5) – This answer indicates that the person feels satisfied about their access level and doesn't have any significant problems, but they still want to highlight some small issues.
  5. Extremely Accessible - I always get everything required for my job role & responsibilities without much effort or struggle because technology tools are readily available whenever needed; this is great! (5) – This answer indicates that the person feels very satisfied about their access level and doesn't have any significant problems at all, but they still want to highlight how easy it usually goes.
  6-10: Not applicable as these numbers indicate a higher degree of satisfaction than what was asked in this question (5) – This answer indicates that the person feels like something is wrong with technology tools accessibility because their level seems too high for them, and they want to highlight how satisfied are about it.
  **Do you think your current work setup allows sufficient use of all necessary technologies?** Please select only one answer: Yes or No (5) – This question aims at understanding whether the person feels like technology tools accessibility is enough in their job role & responsibilities, and they can do everything required with them.

     - Topic: Benefits
     - Question number: 9

[PROMPTS]
     - System: 
You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.
Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic and the number of questions.
Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.

     - User: 
Generate me a questionnaire on Benefits with 9 questions

-------------------
-------------------
[LLM ANSWER]
 **Do your current benefits meet or exceed industry standards for similar companies in terms of quality and quantity? (Please select all that apply)**
 - Yes, they are above average.
- They match the standard but have some room to improve.
- No, I believe our company is behind competitors on this matter.

**Do you feel satisfied with your current health insurance plan options in terms of coverage and premiums? (Please select all that apply)**
 - Yes, very much so! The benefits are excellent for me too.
- Somewhat yes but there' s still room to improve the plans further.
- No I am not happy about it as some treatments or medications aren’t covered properly by our plan and/or premiums seem high compared with other companies in my opinion .**Do you think that benefits offered should be more diverse? (1 being very poor and not at all clear; 2-3 indicating somewhat unclear but with potential growth ahead; 4-5 showing a good level of clarity)**
 - I would rate it as: [Insert rating here] because...[insert explanation if necessary, otherwise leave blank]. For example "I'd give this topic/questionnaire item a score of X and the reason for that is...". This will help us understand your thoughts better! 😊
   * Strongly disagree (1)
   * Disagree (2-3 options available here!)
   * Neither agree nor disagree / Unsure about career path opportunities within our company, but I am open to learning more and improving my understanding of the topic. This is a neutral position that can be influenced by providing information or not! If you are unsure whether your employees understand this concept then it might help them if they were given some additional resources on how their current role fits into larger business goals/career paths available at our company, as well? (4)
   * Agree / Somewhat agree that I have a good understanding of career path opportunities within the organization. This is an indication you feel like there are clear and accessible options for advancement in your team or department! Great job if so; keep it up!! [LLM ANSWER]
 **How clear is the company's messaging about potential growth paths for employees in your department (select all that apply)?**
 - Very Clear: The message from management and HR regarding career path opportunities are very specific, detailed. I am able to understand how my role can evolve within this organization based on these messages; it feels like a well-defined ladder of progression with clear steps for me as an employee in the company! This is great because then there's no confusion or ambiguity around what needs doing next - just follow those instructions and keep moving up.
 	* Clear: The message from management about career path opportunities seems to be quite specific, but not overly detailed; I can understand how my role could evolve within this organization based on these messages without much difficulty! It feels like a well-defined ladder of progression with clear steps for me as an employee in the company.
 	* Somewhat Clear: The message from management about career path opportunities is somewhat specific, but not overly detailed; I can understand how my role could evolve within this organization based on these messages without much difficulty! It feels like a ladder of progression with clear steps for me as an employee in the company.
 	* Not Clear: The message from management about career path opportunities is vague and unclear, making it difficult to determine if there are any growth paths available or what they might entail; this lack of information makes understanding how my role could evolve within this organization challenging! It feels like a ladder without rungs - not helpful at all.
 	* Not At All Clear: The message from management about career path opportunities is completely unclear, making it impossible to determine if there are any growth paths available or what they might entail; I feel left in the dark and uncertain of my future with this organization! It feels like a ladder without rungs - not helpful at all.

[LLM ANSWER]
 **How would you describe the level of clarity about where your career is going at this moment in time (from very clear to not sure)? Please select one option.**
 - Very Clear: I am confident that my future professional path aligns well and have a solid understanding. It' s just as if it was planned by someone else, but with the same goals or even better results than me! This person has done an excellent job in creating this plan for themselves; however sometimes things don’t go exactly according to them because life can be unpredictable - not everything is under our control.
- Clear: I am aware of where my career should lead and feel confident that it will continue on a positive trajectory, but there are still some details or specifics which need clarification before reaching the final destination point; however this doesnt prevent me from feeling good about what' s happening right now! 
 - Somewhat Clear: I have an idea of where my career is going and feel that it will continue to progress in a positive direction, but there are still some uncertainties or questions which need answering before everything becomes clear. It can be difficult for me at times because not all information has been provided yet; however this doesn't stop us from feeling hopeful about the future!
 - Not Sure: I don’ t know where my career is going and feel uncertain, as if there are too many things preventing progress towards a defined goal. It can be difficult for me at times because not having enough information or support needed to make decisions confidently regarding professional growth & development . 	haircut;
 - Not Clear At All: I am completely lost when it comes down thinking where my career might go, and feel like giving up on trying altogether! This lack of clarity makes us question whether continuing with current job/profession is best decision after all. We need help in finding our way again so that we can move forward confidently towards success

**How often do you think about your future professional path? (from always to never)** 	haircut; Please select one option:
 - Always thinking of it and planning for the next step, as if a personal career coach has been assigned just for this purpose! They' re constantly looking ahead & making sure everything is lined up perfectly. It can be quite overwhelming at times due their dedication but we know that person will help us reach our goals in no time ;
 - Thinking about it often and trying to make sense of where things might lead, as if a mentor has been assigned just for this purpose! They' re always available with advice or guidance when needed. It can be helpful at times because having someone who knows what they are doing makes us feel more confident in our decisions;
 - Thinking about it sometimes and trying to figure out where things might lead, as if a friend has been assigned just for this purpose! They' re there occasionally with advice or guidance when needed. It can be helpful at times because having someone who knows what they are doing makes us feel more confident in our decisions;
 - Thinking about it rarely and not sure how to proceed forward without clear direction, as if a stranger has been assigned just for this purpose! They' re unavailable most of the time which leaves little room left thinking where things might lead. It can be difficult at times because having no one else around who knows us well enough makes decisions harder;
 - Never really think about it and feel content with current situation, as if a hermit has been assigned just for this purpose! They' re living life without much consideration of future consequences or planning ahead beyond what needs to happen right now. It can be quite liberating at times due lack concern but we know that person will struggle reaching their goals in time

[LLM ANSWER]
 **Which type(s) or source(s) motivate YOU in the workplace: Intrinsic, External (supervisor), Monetary rewards and benefits OR Other:** ________________

**Do you feel that your work is meaningful? If not what could be changed to make it more fulfilling for yourself personally AND others on YOUR team or department as a whole ?**: Yes / No. Please explain why in 50 words (minimum) if selected "No". Include specifics about the change(s).

**Do you feel that your skills and abilities are being used to their fullest extent? If not, what steps can be taken by management or yourself personally for better utilization of talents ?**: Yes / No. Please explain why in 50 words (minimum) if selected "No". Include specifics about the change(s).

**Do you feel that your work environment is conducive to productivity and creativity? If not, what steps can be taken by management or yourself personally for better utilization of talents ?**: Yes / No. Please explain why in 50 words (minimum) if selected "No". Include specifics about the change(s).

**Do you feel that your work environment is conducive to productivity and creativity? If not, what steps can be taken by management or yourself personally for better utilization of talents ?**: Yes / No. Please explain why in 50 words (minimum) if selected "No". Include specifics about the change(s).

**Do you feel that your work environment is conducive to productivity and creativity? If not, what steps can be taken by management or yourself personally for better utilization of talents ?**: Yes / No. Please explain why in 50 words (minimum) if selected "No". Include specifics about the change(s).
[/1] **Do you feel that your work is meaningful? If not, what could be changed to make it more fulfilling for yourself personally and others on YOUR team or department as a whole ?** Yes / No. Please explain why in 50 words (minimum) if selected "No". Include specifics about the change(s).
```python
- If not, please specify what would be changed to make it more fulfilling for yourself personally and others on your team or department as a whole: ________________ . For example; More autonomy in decision making process , Better communication from management etc. 50 words minimum required here too! (Please note that this is not an actual question, but rather something to be added if the answer was "No")
```

[LLM ANSWER]
 **How often do your team members give and receive feedback in the workplace environment, including both positive reinforcement as well as constructive criticism for improvement purposes (not just once but regularly)? Please specify.**
- Every day or almost every workday.
- Once a week to three times per month.
- Only during performance evaluation periods like quarterly/half year and annually etc.. 
- Never, we don't have any feedback mechanism in place at all! I am open for new ideas :).
 - Other (please specify)... ________________________.
**Do you think that the current method of giving or receiving verbal face to face/in person and written through email is effective? Please select one.** 
- Yes, it's perfect. It allows me time for reflection before responding which helps in understanding my own performance better as well others'. I can also prepare myself accordingly if needed! ________________________.
 - Nope not at all; we should use a more interactive method like video conferencing or face to face meetings so that communication is clear and effective. It's important for me too, right? :( ....... ._..........................___ _.
- I am fine with either as long as the message gets through clearly without confusion! ________________________.

- Maybe not directly but over time as people become more aware of their strengths & weaknesses they can work together better! It's an indirect effect though :). ....... ._..........................___ _. **Do you think that the current method or frequency for giving/receiving verbal face to face, in person and written through email are effective?** Please select one.** Yes; I am sure about it. This is a JSON representation of a questionnaire about feedback mechanisms. The questionnaire has four questions, each with possible answers and a unique code. The first question asks about the frequency of feedback in the workplace, the second about the effectiveness of the feedback method, the third about comfort with giving and receiving feedback, and the fourth about the preferred feedback method. The answers are displayed as they would be presented to the user, with radio buttons for selecting a single answer.

     - System: 
You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.

     - User: 
Generate me a questionnaire on Health and Safety Measures with 6 questions

-------------------
-------------------
[LLM ANSWER]
 **Do you feel that there is enough focus placed upon health & safety in this organization, including yourself being safe at all times while performing duties for the company (Yes or No)?**
- Yes
- No

**Have any of your colleagues been injured on site due to lack of proper equipment and training? If yes - how many people have you seen getting hurt because they were not provided with adequate resources, including personal protective gear if required by their job description.** Please specify the number. (0 being no one) 6 questions
- Yes – at least once or more than that; please provide a specific answer in numbers and details about what happened to them as well how it could have been prevented then we can discuss further on this topic! If not, proceed with next question below:(Please note if you are answering yes for the first time ever since working here – I would like very much information regarding incident report so that management team will be able make necessary adjustments in order to prevent similar incidents from happening again.)
- No; no one has been injured on site due lack of proper equipment and training. (Please note if you are answering yes for the first time ever since working here – I would like very much information regarding incident report so that management team will be able make necessary adjustments in order to prevent similar incidents from happening again.)
- Not sure; please let me know how many people have been injured on site due lack of proper equipment and training. (Please note if you are answering yes for the first time ever since working here – I would like very much information regarding incident report so that management team will be able make necessary adjustments in order to prevent similar incidents from happening again.)
- Not sure; please let me know how many people have been injured on site due lack of proper equipment and training. (Please note if you are answering yes for the first time ever since working here – I would like very much information regarding incident report so that management team will be able make necessary adjustments in order to prevent similar incidents from happening again.)
- Not sure; please let me know how many people have been injured on site due lack of proper equipment and training. (Please note if you are answering yes for the first time ever since working here – I would like very much information regarding incident report so that management team will be able make necessary adjustments in order to prevent similar incidents from happening again.)
- Not sure; please let me know how many people have been injured on site due lack of proper equipment and training. (Please note if you are answering yes for the first time ever since working here – I would like very much information regarding incident report so that management team will be able make necessary adjustments in order to prevent similar incidents from happening again.)
- Not sure; please let me know how many people have been injured on site due lack of proper equipment and training. (Please note if you are answering yes for the first time ever since working here – I would like very much information regarding incident report so that management team will be able make necessary adjustments in order to prevent similar incidents from happening again.)
- Not sure; please let me know how many people have been injured on site due lack of proper equipment and training. (Please note if you are answering yes for the first time ever since working here – I would like very much information regarding incident report so that management team will be able make necessary adjustments in order to prevent similar incidents from happening again.)
- Not sure; please let me know how many people have been injured on site due lack of proper equipment and training.      - System: 
You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.
Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic and the number of questions.
Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.

[LLM ANSWER]
 **Do you feel that internal mobility opportunities are adequately promoted within your organization? (Select all options)**
- Yes, I am very satisfied and think there is enough information about moving to another role.
- Somewhat yes but could be improved by providing more resources or communication channels for employees looking forward to a new position in the company.
- No not at all; internal mobility opportunities are rarely discussed within my organization which makes me feel unaware of potential roles I can apply and grow professionally inside this firm, making it harder than necessary if someone wants an opportunity outside their current department or team without knowing what's available internally first before looking elsewhere.
- Prefer not to say because you don’t know enough about internal mobility opportunities within your organization yet but would like more information in order make a decision on this matter! Please provide some resources so I can learn and decide whether there are good chances for me inside the company or if external search is needed instead; thanks.
- Other (please specify)...
  - **Do you think that internal mobility opportunities should be encouraged within your organization?** Yes, definitely because it helps employees grow professionally while staying with one employer and can lead to better job satisfaction which in turn increases productivity of the whole company! It's a win/win situation. No I don’t believe so; people tend not move around enough inside companies these days making them less loyal than they used be, preferring quick money over long-term relationships with their employers and that can lead to brain drain which is bad for business in general but especially when it comes from within an organization!
  - **Have you ever been offered a chance of internal mobility?** Yes I have had several chances already. No not yet; unfortunately, no one has given me such opportunity so far even though there were open positions that would fit my skills perfectly and could help both myself as well the company by filling those gaps more quickly than hiring externally!
  - **Do you think internal mobility opportunities are important for employees?** Yes of course because it allows them to learn new things, meet different people from various backgrounds which can broaden their horizons making better team players and managers in turn. No not really; I don’t see any value coming out if someone moves around inside a company too much as they won't be able establish deep relationships with colleagues or become an expert at anything, just jumping between roles like headless chicken without clear career path!
  - **Do you think internal mobility opportunities are important for the organization?** Yes of course because it helps companies retain valuable talent and build loyal workforce which is crucial in today's competitive market. [LLM ANSWER]
 **Do you feel encouraged by your company's internal mobility opportunities for employees who perform well in their current role, but want another position within the organization (Yes or No)?** If yes: How many times have you changed positions internally? Please select one. * More than 3 Times - I am a seasoned professional with multiple promotions and transfers inside my company!
* Twice – This is not just luck, but an opportunity to grow within the organization that has been repeated twice for me personally as well... (2 times)
* Once- A single time of internal mobility was enough. It gave you a chance at something new in your career and helped broaden horizons! * Never had this experience yet - I am still waiting, but looking forward to it with positive anticipation :) ....(0 Times). If no: Why do not feel encouraged? Please select one or more of the following.
* Not enough opportunities are available for internal mobility (1) – The company does offer promotions and transfers internally; however I am missing out on them! :/ * My performance is good, but it's hard to get noticed by management team in order be considered as a candidate - 2). It seems that my contributions aren’t recognized or highlighted enough (3) – The company does not have the right processes and tools for me being seen.
* I am simply unaware of internal mobility opportunities within organization- Please educate! :) ...(4), because no one has told you about them yet, so it's hard to be interested in something that is unknown... (5) * Other - please specify: ....I have a different reason for not feeling encouraged.
**Do the company’s internal mobility opportunities align with your career goals? Please select all options which apply.*** The organization offers me positions and roles I am looking forward to, as they match my personal ambitions (2) * Some of them do - but others don't quite fit in...(3).
* Not at this time – But the company is working on it! :) ...I believe that there will be a perfect role for me soon. Just need some more patience and trust from management side to get what I am looking forward (4) * Other - please specify: ....My career goals are not aligned with internal mobility opportunities at all, as they don't match my personal ambitions or simply do not exist in the company!
**Do you feel that your performance is rewarded by promotions and transfers internally? Please select one.*** Yes – I am a high performer who has been recognized multiple times for great work (2) * Somewhat - It's hard to tell, but it seems like my contributions are not fully appreciated or seen.
* No- My performance is good; however the company does not seem interested in rewarding me with internal mobility opportunities :( ...I am just unlucky! ....It feels that I need more luck and support from management side (4) * Other - please specify: .....My contributions are simply overlooked or there's no chance for promotions at all.
**Do you feel encouraged to apply internally when a position opens? Please select one.*** Yes – If it is open, I will definitely try my best and go after this opportunity! (2) * Somewhat - It depends on the role...I am not sure if that's something for me or just another person.
* No- The company does offer internal mobility opportunities; however they are simply unreachable to you :( ...It seems like I need more luck and support from management side (4) * Other – please specify: ....My contributions aren’t recognized enough, so it's hard for me being considered as a candidate.
**Do the company values internal mobility? Please select one.*** Yes- The organization has been known to be supportive of employees who want more and better roles internally (2) * Somewhat – It seems like there are some opportunities; however they aren’t fully supported by management team or HR processes...(3).
* No - I am afraid that the company does not value internal mobility at all :/ ...It's simply a wrong place for me to be and grow (4) * Other- please specify: ....The organization is just unaware of importance, benefits from having employees who are motivated enough.

This JSON object represents a questionnaire with 7 questions, each having 4 possible answers. The questions are asking whether the person feels that their performance is rewarded by promotions and transfers internally, whether they feel encouraged to apply internally when a position opens, whether the company values internal mobility, and whether they feel that internal mobility is encouraged in the company. The answers to these questions can help determine if a person is satisfied with their current job and if they feel valued by the company.

[LLM ANSWER]
 **Do you feel that your work is valued by this organization, not just in terms of compensation but also recognition for effort put into projects or tasks completed successfully?**
 - Yes, always
- Sometimes yes and sometimes no. I do think there are areas where my contributions could be more recognized! But overall it's a positive experience working here :)
- No, never (or almost)
 	Please elaborate on why you feel this way in the comments section below... It would help us understand better if we need to change our approach. Thank You!! :D
 - I don’t know / Can not answer because it's subjective and hard for me as a computer program! But please encourage your employees who are unsure about their job satisfaction level, or just ask them directly what they think... It can be very enlightening ;) 	Please select only one option.
**Do you feel motivated to do good work every day? If not why is that the case and how could we improve it so motivation levels increase again in our team/department ? **   - Yes, always! I love my job :D It's great waking up knowing what needs done today & having clear goals set with management.
- Sometimes yes but sometimes no... There are days when things seem tougher than others though overall it evens out around 50/50 mark (or slightly above). If this is the case for you, please let us know why do YOU think that happens? Is there something specific causing these fluctuations in motivation levels within our team or department.
- No not really... I'm just here because of financial reasons and would prefer another job if given opportunity! Please help me understand what makes my position seem less fulfilling than others might be experiencing so we can address this issue together as a company :( 	Please select only one option, but feel free to elaborate in the comments section.
**Do you think there is enough support from management and colleagues when needed? If not how could it improve.**   - Yes definitely! I have all resources required at hand whenever necessary which makes me able perform tasks efficiently without feeling stressed out or overwhelmed by deadlines/pressure etc... 	Please select only one option.
- Sometimes yes sometimes no, depending on specific situation and person involved in helping process :( If this is the case for you please help us understand what would make your experience better so we can implement changes needed across entire organization! Thank You!! :)   - No not really.. I feel like management doesn't care about me or my needs. Please explain why do YOU think that happens? We want to hear from employees directly and address any concerns they might have, even if it means changing our approach slightly...
**Do you believe your skills are being used optimally within the company structure/hierarchy ? If not how could we better utilize them for mutual benefit.**   - Yes definitely! I feel like my talents & abilities get full use here which makes me happy and engaged in projects. 	Please select only one option, but please elaborate if you think there are areas where your skills aren't being used optimally within the company structure/hierarchy so we can address it together as a team!
- Sometimes yes sometimes no... There could be room for improvement when allocating tasks based on people’s strengths and weaknesses. If this is true please help us understand what would make your experience better, even if that means changing our approach slightly to suit YOUR needs best :). 	Please select only one option!
**Do you feel like there' s a good balance between work life responsibilities? Or do they spill over into personal time too much causing stress and burnout.**   - Yes definitely. I have clear boundaries set which allows me enjoy my private live without feeling guilty about not working hard enough during office hours :). We want to hear from employees directly so we can address any concerns THEY might have!

[LLM ANSWER]
 **What is your relationship (if any) with leaders in this organization, if you have one or more than the better.**
   - I am not aware of anyone who can be classified as leader. (where only person is a manager) or if you have direct experience with them, please rate their leadership skills from your perspective

     - Question number: 7

[PROMPTS]
     - System: 
You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.
Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic and the number of questions.
Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.

     - User: 
Generate me a questionnaire on Leadership Effectiveness with 7 questions

-------------------
-------------------
[LLM ANSWER]
 **On a scale of 1 to 5, how would you rate the effectiveness of our company's leadership team overall in terms of visionary thinking (1 being very poor and not effective at all; 5 is highly efficient)?**
 - Strongly disagree: Leadership does NOT have good visions for this organization. They are too focused on short-term goals or do things that harm the long term successes, if any! :(  
    * Somewhat Disagree (2)    
      > I don't think leadership has a clear vision and plan to make our company successful in future years ahead...      
 - Neither agree nor disagree: Leadership is just average at setting goals for the organization. They are not bad but also have no great ideas or plans! :|   (3)    
    * Somewhat Agree                 
      > I think leadership has a clear vision and plan to make our company successful in future years ahead...      
 - Strongly agree: Leadership is very good at setting goals for the organization. They have excellent skills, ideas & plans! :D   (5)    
    * Somewhat Agree                 
      > I think leadership has a clear vision and plan to make our company successful in future years ahead...      
 - Neutral: Leadership is just average at setting goals for the organization. They are not bad but also have no great ideas or plans! :|   (3)    
    * Somewhat disagree                 
      > I don't think leadership has a clear vision and plan to make our company successful in future years ahead...      
 - Strongly Disagree: Leadership does NOT have good visions for this organization. They are too focused on short-term goals or do things that harm the long term successes, if any! :(   (1)    
    * Somewhat disagree                 
      > I don't think leadership has a clear vision and plan to make our company successful in future years ahead...      
 - Don’t know: Not sure about this question. Please give me more information or context so that can answer it better! :|   (1)    
    * Strongly disagree                 
      > Leadership does NOT have good visions for the organization at all, and they are not effective in setting goals to make our company successful...      
 - Somewhat agree: I think leadership is pretty decent but could be much better. They need more training or skills! :|   (2)

Hi John! This email message serves as a friendly one day advance notice for our scheduled meeting on Wednesday at 2pm ET, so you can be prepared and have all necessary materials available if needed.<br>Looking forward to seeing your smiling face in person.`; Subject Line Evaluation—Meeting Reminder
The subject line "MEETING REMINDER" is written entirely capital letters which makes it seem less personalized for the recipient, John Doe and could be perceived as impersonal or spammy.<br>To make this more effective consider using a lowercase title with an individual's name included: 'Meeting Reminder – One Day Advance Notice For You'.

Generate me a questionnaire on Onboarding Experience with 6 questions

-------------------
-------------------
[LLM ANSWER]
 **Onboarding Process:** How would you rate the following aspects of your recent or current job? Please select one answer for each statement. If possible, please provide specific examples to support your answers and elaborate why certain feelings exist about this process:
  1) The speed at which I was able to become familiar with my role’s responsibilities – **Very satisfied** / Somewhat Satisfied/Neutral/Somewhat Unsatisified/**Not At All Satisfied**. Please explain your answer. For example, if you are not completely happy about the onboarding process because of a specific issue or event that took place during this time and would like to share it with us – please do so in as much detail as possible
  2) The amount/quantity / volume (please choose one word only!) of information I received before starting my job, including about the company culture - **Too Much**/**Just Right**/Not Enough. Please elaborate if you feel that too little or perhaps even an overload was present and why this is your opinion
  3) The support provided by colleagues during onboarding process – Very satisfied/Somewhat Satisfied /Neutral /** Not At All Satisifed**. If not completely happy, please provide specific examples of what could have been done differently or better. This will help us improve our future programs and make them more effective for all employees
  4) The communication level with my manager during onboarding process – Very satisfied/Somewhat Satisfied /Neutral /** Not At All Satisifed**. Please explain in detail if you feel that the lack of contact or poor quality information was present. This is important as it can affect your overall satisfaction and performance at work
  5) The resources provided for me to perform my job – Very satisfied/Somewhat Satisfied /Neutral /** Not At All Satisifed**. Please share with us if you feel that certain tools or materials were missing, which would have helped make this process smoother. We value your input and want everyone in our company - including new hires like yourself – to be successful
  6) The overall onboarding experience at the organization (please choose one answer only!) **Very Satisfied** /Somewhat satisfied/Neutral/**Not At All SATISFIED**. We would appreciate it if you could provide us with a detailed account of your feelings and thoughts about this process. This will help improve our onboarding program for future new hires, ensuring they have the best possible start in their role within organization
Please remember that all answers are anonymous so please feel free to share as much detail as needed!

     - Topic: WorkLife Balance
     - Question number: 8

     - Topic: Pressure at work
     - Question number: 14
-------------------
[PROMPTS]
     - System: 
You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.
Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic and the number of questions.
Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.
Be creative and vary the syntax of your questions to enhance user engagement. 

     - User: 
Generate me a questionnaire on Pressure at work with 14 questions

-------------------
-------------------
[LLM ANSWER]
 **Do you feel that your job is stressful and pressured most of the time (pressures from targets, deadlines)?**
 - Yes
    o I agree completely. My Job feels like an extreme pressure cooker! The heat needs to be turned down a little bit or at least more evenly distributed so it doesn't feel as intense all day long... 🥄🔥
  - No
    ο That’s great, but have you ever felt any work related pressures? If yes then please specify the areas where pressure is less and would like to see some changes. _______________☎️👍🏻
    o I don't know how someone can feel that way because of this question! 🤐 But if there are specific things causing stress, it might be helpful for them (and the company)to address those issues and find a more comfortable temperature. _______________☎️👍🏻

[LLM ANSWER]
 **Do your current recognition & rewards program meet employee needs effectively (1 being very poor, 5 being excellent)?**
- Strongly disagree: Not at all satisfied - Disagree: Somewhat dissatisfied – Neutral or indifferent - Agree: Satisfied but not completely happy with the system in place. I would be more than delighted if it was perfect! - Strictly agree (10 out of 5): Yes, absolutely and beyond my expectations
> **Do you think that your organization recognizes employees’ efforts effectively?**- Never – Rarely: Less often then once a month or less frequently.- Occasionally:- Frequently : At least every two weeks but not more than one time in seven days. - Almost always (3 out of 4): More frequent recognition would be great!
> **Do you think that your organization rewards employees’ efforts effectively?**- Never – Rarely: Less often then once a month or less frequently.- Occasionally:- Frequently : At least every two weeks but not more than one time in seven days. - Almost always (3 out of 4): More frequent recognition would be great!
> **Do you think that your organization rewards employees’ efforts fairly?**- Never – Rarely: Less often then once a month or less frequently.- Occasionally:- Frequently : At least every two weeks but not more than one time in seven days. - Almost always (3 out of 4): More frequent recognition would be great!
> **What types/categories do you think should get recognized and rewarded?**- Monetary rewards: Bonuses, raises or other financial incentives.- Nonmonetary awards : Praise from supervisors & peers; public acknowledgement in front others. - Both (50% monetary / 50 % non)
> **Do you think that your organization recognizes and reward employees based on their performance?**- Never – Rarely: Less often then once a month or less frequently.- Occasionally:- Frequently : At least every two weeks but not more than one time in seven days. - Almost always (3 out of 4): More frequent recognition would be great!

[LLM ANSWER]
 **Do you feel that your work is recognized by management team in our company (put at top what worked best)?**
 - Always, because I am an indispensable employee. The recognition of my performance has been consistent throughout the years!
 - Very often and it makes me happy to be appreciated for all efforts made towards successes achieved as a whole organization or individually by team members like myself who contribute significantly with their talents; this also helps keep morale high which then translates into better productivity. (50 characters) [^1] 	- Often, but I would prefer it if recognition was more frequent and specific to my contributions
 - Sometimes because of the nature of work or team size not allowing everyone's efforts visible enough for management notice; however this doesnt stop me from giving best possible results every time! (50 characters)  	- Rarely as there are many other things that need attention before individual recognition can be given due importance.
 - Never, because I don’t think my work is recognized at all and it makes feel unappreciated which affects motivation negatively impacting performance too much sometimes even causing burnout if not addressed properly through communication channels between employees & managers alike so they know what's going on in each others minds as well
 	- Not applicable, because I don’t think recognition is important for me to feel motivated and perform at my best. (50 characters) [^1] **Do you prefer public or private acknowledgement of your work?**  
 - Publicly so that everyone knows about it including family & friends who can then share in the joy with us! 	- Private, because I am not comfortable being praised openly and would rather have a quiet word from manager/supervisor. (50 characters) [^1] **Do you think our company has an effective recognition program?**
 - Yes definitely; we use various methods such as bonuses or awards ceremonies which make people feel valued & motivated to continue performing well even under pressure situations where they might otherwise give up easily due lack of motivation boost provided by proper acknowledgement system. (50 characters) [^1] 	- Not quite, but it could be improved with more communication between departments and teams about what is working for others so we can learn from each other's successes too!
 - No not really; there seems to only focus on numbers rather than people which makes me feel like just another cog in machine instead of human being capable making decisions affecting entire organization positively or negatively. (50 characters) [^1] 	- I don’t know, because no recognition program has been implemented yet and it would be great if one could exist to help motivate employees more effectively through positive reinforcement rather than just negative consequences for not meeting targets set by management without understanding how hard those goals really are sometimes. (50 characters) [^1] **Do you think our company provides enough rewards?**
 - Yes, because I am always rewarded when doing good job and this encourages me to keep pushing myself further beyond limits previously thought possible! 	- Not quite yet; there could definitely be more opportunities given out especially for those who work hard consistently over time without much recognition or appreciation shown them in form of tangible rewards. (50 characters) [^1]  
 - No, because I don’t think management understands how difficult our jobs can really be sometimes and that extra effort should not go unnoticed when producing excellent results which benefit everyone involved including shareholders who see higher profits due increased productivity levels achieved through teamwork & collaboration. (50 characters) [^1] 	- Not sure, because I don’t know if there is a system in place to measure performance and reward accordingly based on merit rather than just giving out rewards randomly which would then feel unfair for some people while others get more even though they might not deserve it as much. (50 characters) [^1] **Do you think our company provides enough recognition?**

(50 characters) [^1] **Do you think our company provides enough opportunities?**
 - Yes, because I am always given chances when needed and this encourages me to keep performing at high level even under pressure situations where others might give up easily due lack of motivation boost provided by proper acknowledgement system. (50 characters) [^1] **Do you think our company provides enough growth?**
 - Yes, because I am always given chance to learn new things and this encourages me keep pushing myself further beyond limits previously thought possible! 	- Not quite yet; there could definitely be more opportunities for learning within the organization especially when it comes time training or education which would then allow us showcase our skills even better than before. (50 characters) [^1]

(50 characters) [^1] 	- Not sure, because I don’t know if there is a system in place to measure performance and provide growth accordingly based on merit rather than just giving opportunities randomly which would then feel unfair for some people while others get more even though they might not deserve it as much. [LLM ANSWER]
 **To what extent have training programs helped improve your job performance at work? (1 being not helpful, 5 being very effective)**
 - Not Helpful At All: The program did nothing to help you perform better. You feel like the time spent on these activities could be used more productively in other ways or that they are completely unnecessary for doing a good job and contributing positively within your team/organization. (1) 	- A Little Bit But Not Much
    - Somewhat Helpful: The program provided some benefits, but there is still room to improve the content of these activities so you can get more value from them in order not just for yourself as an individual participant or attendee; this also applies if someone else will benefit too because it's important that everyone gets maximum advantage out. (2)
    - Helpful: The program was good and provided useful information, but there are still some areas where improvements can be made to make them even better suited for your needs as a participant or attendee; this could include things like making materials more accessible online so people don't have trouble finding what they need when it comes time. (3)
    - Very Helpful: The program was excellent and provided exactly the right amount of information, tools, resources etc., that you needed in order to perform your job better; this means everything from content delivery format through assessment methods used all seemed perfect for maximizing learning potential without being too complicated or simple. (4)
    - Extremely Helpful: The program was fantastic and provided an abundance of valuable insights about how best practices should be implemented within the workplace, making you feel like a completely different person after participating in these activities compared with beforehand; this is something everyone wants to experience! 	- Unsure (0)
    - Prefer not say (-1): I don't want or can’t answer because of some reason. - Very satisfied, completely agree (5)
- Satisfied to some extent but not fully agreed(4)
- Neutral about the program quality or quantity. Not positive nor negative.(3)
- Dissatisfied with these trainings and development opportunities for employees like me in this company 2/10).
- Very dissatisfied, completely disagree (5): I am extremely unhappy! This is a big problem that needs to be addressed immediately by the management. The training programs are not good enough or do not exist at all.(6)
**Do you think these trainings and development opportunities have helped your performance in this organization? Please rate:** 10 = Yes, it has been extremely helpful for me! I am able now perform better than before because of the great quality. I am not fully satisfied with what is available now.(3) / No, completely disagree: There aren't any or very few possibilities at all! This needs urgent attention from management!(6).

- Manager of Department

**Have your ever participated in any formal Training/Development program? Please select all options applicable:**
- Yes, multiple times (more than once)
- Once or twice but not recently. I am open for new opportunities now though :). If you selected another option above and would like to take a training course then choose that instead! 😊 - Other reason: Not at this time due budget constraints / lack of resources/time, etc.. Please specify in the text field below
- Prefer not answer. I am happy with current knowledge level but open for new opportunities as well :). [LLM ANSWER]
 **Do you feel like your work responsibilities are affecting other important parts of life? (Please select only one answer)**
- Yes, I often miss out on things that matter to maintain my job.
- Sometimes it feels this way but not consistently or significantly enough for me to consider changing something in the workplace environment and culture so as a result can be considered no because there is always room of improvement with communication between employees/employers about work life balance issues which could help alleviate some problems if addressed properly.
- No, I am able manage my time well without any negative impact on personal relationships or activities outside the workplace environment and culture that are important to me too! 🙂
**Do you feel like your organization cares for its employees? (Please select only one answer)**
 - Yes definitely they care about their people but sometimes it's hard noticing due lack of communication channels between teams/departments or even managers which could be improved with better tools and techniques. This is why I choose yes! 🙂
- Sometimes, because there isn’t enough time dedicated to employee wellbeing in the workplace environment culture that can lead people feeling unimportant but this doesn't mean they don't care just not showing it properly so answer would still be considered maybe with some effort put into creating more positive work life balance then perhaps things might change.
- No, I do NOT feel like my organization cares for its employees because there are no initiatives or programs aimed at improving quality of working lives which could help alleviate stress and burnout among team members if only management would take notice! 😞**Do you have enough time to complete your work? (Please select one answer)**
 - Yes, I am able manage my tasks without feeling overwhelmed by deadlines or pressure from managers who may not understand how long certain things actually require. This is why this question gets a yes response today but tomorrow might be different if circumstances change! 🙂
- Sometimes it feels like there isn't enough time available for all the work required which could lead to longer hours spent working than desired and possible burnout without proper communication channels between teams/departments or even managers who can help alleviate some problems with better tools, techniques; so answer would still be considered maybe.
- No I do NOT have sufficient resources including time allocated for completing work required by the organization due to high demands placed upon employees that could easily solved through improved communication channels between teams/departments or even managers who can help alleviate some problems with better tools, techniques; so answer would still be considered no. 😞**Do you feel like your personal life is respected and supported by the organization? (Please select only one)**
 - Yes definitely! The workplace environment culture respects individual needs including those related to family or other commitments outside work which helps create better balance between professional responsibilities while maintaining healthy relationships too. 🙂
- Sometimes it feels this way but not consistently enough for me consider changing anything in the organization because there aren't always communication channels available that allow people understand each others’ situations and needs; so answer would still be considered maybe with some effort put into creating more positive work life balance then perhaps things might change. 😐
- No, I do NOT feel like my personal commitments are respected or supported by the organization because there aren't enough resources including time allocated for completing all tasks required which could easily solved through improved communication channels between teams/department and even managers who can help alleviate some problems with better tools techniques; so answer would still be considered no. 😞**Do you feel like your work life balance is good? (Please select only one)**
 - Yes, I am able manage my time well without feeling overwhelmed by deadlines or pressure from managers who may not understand how long certain things actually require and have enough resources including personal commitments outside the workplace environment that are important to me too! 🙂
- Sometimes it feels like there isn't a good work life balance which could lead longer hours spent working than desired without proper communication channels between teams/department or even managers who can help alleviate some problems with better tools, techniques; so answer would still be considered maybe. But I am not sure if this is the case for everyone! 😐
- No, my work life balance isn't good because there aren’t enough resources including time allocated to complete all tasks required by organization and personal commitments outside workplace environment that are important too; so answer would still be considered no. And I believe many people feel the same way as me! 😞**Do you have a chance for self-reflection about your work? (Please select only one)**
 - Yes, there is ample opportunity to reflect on my performance and how it relates not just with colleagues but also overall organizational goals which helps create better understanding of what needs improving or maintaining. This question gets yes response today! 🙂
- Sometimes I feel like self reflection isn't possible due high demands placed upon employees that could easily solved through improved communication channels between teams/department and even managers who can help alleviate some problems with tools, techniques; so answer would still be considered maybe. But not sure if this is the case for everyone! 😐
- No I do NOT feel like there are opportunities available to reflect on my performance because of high demands placed upon employees that could easily solved through improved communication channels between teams/department and even managers who can help alleviate some problems with tools, techniques; so answer would still be considered no. And this is a big problem in many organizations today! 😞

This is a JSON representation of the Work Life Balance questionnaire with 7 questions. Each question has a unique code, name, and type\_id. The type\_id is used to determine the type of question and the possible answers for that question. The display\_order property is used to determine the order in which the questions should be displayed. The\_TF\_ANSWERS array contains all the possible answers for a question and their corresponding code.

[LLM ANSWER]
 **How would you rate your overall work-life balance? (1 being very poor, 10 being excellent)**
 - Less than average of employees in the company is not satisfied. They feel overloaded and stressed out due to heavy load at their workplace: Yes or No
    > * If yes then please provide a reason for this answer with example if possible like- I am working more hours because my workload doesnt allow me finish on time, My manager assigns too many tasks which is not manageable etc. and also ask about any solution they have in mind to improve it?
    > * If no then please provide a reason for this answer with example if possible like- I am able to maintain balance between work life because of flexible schedule or good management skills, Because company policy allows me time off when needed so i can manage my tasks and deadlines easily etc. And also ask about any challenges they are facing in managing their heavy load?
 - On a scale 10 how would you rate your ability to effectively prioritize workload demands: (Please provide reason for this answer) like- I am able because of good management skills, company policy or tools and techniques used by them etc. And also ask about any challenges they are facing in managing their heavy load?
    > * If yes then please specify how do you manage your time between different tasks with example if possible so that we can understand the technique better like- I am using some software which helps me to prioritize my task and i feel less stressed. And also ask about any challenges they are facing in managing their heavy load?
    > * If no then please specify how do you manage your time between different tasks with example if possible so that we can understand the technique better like- I am not able because of lack management skills or tools, company policy is very strict and doesnt allow me to take decisions about my workload etc. And also ask them what challenges they are facing in prioritizing their task?
 - On a scale 10 how would you rate your ability cope with the volume/amount (quantity) of tasks: Please provide reason for this answer like- I am able because i have good management skills, company policy or tools and techniques used by them etc. And also ask about any challenges they are facing in coping their heavy load?

**Do you feel that there is an even distribution between personal time, family life, social activities outside the office space versus working hours during a typical day at this company/organization for which I am employed currently? If not please elaborate.** --------------------

 **How often do your tasks and projects have clearly defined deadlines or timelines to complete them (percentage)?** ______________ % of my workload has clear timeframes. The rest is open-ended, with no specific deadline for completion: - Percent that does not feel like a lot / 10
	+ I am constantly chasing the end and feeling stressed about completing tasks on this account alone (5) +++(2)/+++++(3). This has become my new normal. The rest of it is just too much to handle in one day or week, so deadlines are spread out over a longer period than initially planned: - Percent that I feel comfortable with and can manage easily without feeling overwhelmed by the workload (5) ++++/++++(3).

     - System:
